• The travelling assembly has a slidable member that can be positioned by the button for which the buttonhole is to be sewn, and a tab that actuates a tripping lever on the machine to limit the length of the buttonhole.
• An adjustable stop on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of the buttonhole, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point and prevent open or overlapping buttonholes.
• The operator can adjust the position of the adjustable stop to compensate for the slippage of different materials relative to the feed dog during sewing.
• The device is designed to be generally similar to a previously disclosed buttonhole controlling device, with the addition of the adjustable stop to improve the consistency of the buttonholes produced.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution.
* The apparatus includes a conveyor with an endless sieve belt, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch between the applicator and the suction device to allow the liquid to act on the web for a longer time.
* The dwell stretch can be an "air pass" with freely rotating rollers or a sieve drum with guide rollers, which allows the web to be guided with little tension.
* The suction device is positioned near the return of the web to the sieve belt, causing the web to adhere to the belt and be entrained by it, reducing longitudinal tensile stresses in the web.
</summary>

<summary>
• The dry cleaning machine described in the text has a separate air flow system that draws in ambient air through the access opening when the door is opened, without exhausting the solvent vapors from the tubs.
• The machine also has a refrigeration system that condenses the solvent vapors during the drying portion of the cleaning cycle, and a "cartridge dry" feature that allows the filter cartridges to be dried without advancing the timer or rotating the tub.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes a method and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments using non-eductive drawing, which addresses the limitations of conventional eductive and non-eductive spinning systems.
* The key features of the invention include a quench chamber, a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width, and the use of the same air for quenching and drawing the filaments, resulting in improved web formation, higher spinning speeds, and easier maintenance.
* The invention is flexible and can accommodate a wide variety of polymers and operating conditions, and can be used to produce fine continuous filaments for various applications, including nonwoven webs and other products.
</summary>

<summary>
• The sewing machine can detect an ultrasonic wave transmitted from an ultrasonic pen using multiple receivers and identify the position specified on the work cloth by the ultrasonic pen.
• The receivers can be placed in various positions on the sewing machine or an embroidery unit attached to the sewing machine to satisfy certain conditions for accurate position detection.
• The sewing machine can calculate the specified position on the work cloth by solving simultaneous equations based on the detection timings of the ultrasonic wave at the multiple receivers.
• The sewing machine can then move the work cloth or the embroidery frame to align the specified position with the needle drop point and start sewing at the specified position.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to the use of ultrafine wool powder and ultrafine bamboo powder as carriers for functional additives such as UV protection and antibacterial agents to be applied on cellulosic fabric materials like cotton.
* The ultrafine wool powder and bamboo powder demonstrate exceptional carrying and retention capability for the functional additives, enhancing the durability of the functional enhancements on the cellulosic fabric.
* The treated fabrics exhibit improved properties such as UV protection, moisture management, wicking, and wrinkle resistance, even after multiple washing cycles.
* The invention provides an environmentally friendly and economical way to utilize short and weak wool fibers that are typically discarded, as well as bamboo fibers, to enhance the functional properties of cellulosic fabrics.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a frame quilting machine that can sew patterns into large fabrics, such as bedspreads and quilts, using a computer-controlled system.
• The key feature of the invention is that it uses two separate computers or process controllers - one to control the sewing machine functions and one to control the movement of the quilting table, allowing for independent reprogramming of each function.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image.
* The fabric is formed from a first precursor web with a first fibrous matrix and a second precursor web with a second fibrous matrix, with a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim in between.
* The precursor webs are subjected to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device, which imparts the three-dimensional image.
* The support layer or scrim acts as a fiber distribution control layer, preventing excessive intermingling of the two fibrous matrices.
* The fabric can have different fiber compositions on the two sides, with the side with the lower fiber modulus contacting the image transfer device.
* The fabric can be further treated with binders, surfactants, or other compositions to modify its properties.
* The fabric can be used in a variety of applications, including home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and other products.
* The fabric exhibits improved durability, softness, and three-dimensional imaging compared to conventional nonwoven fabrics.
* The method of manufacturing the fabric is more efficient than traditional textile processes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
* The device includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted after being contacted by the strip, with the movement of the stop controlling a signal transmitter for a setting means for the stop.
* The device ensures a continuous operation, allows for sewing relatively stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garment parts.
* The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, one or both of which are movable.
* The two tape-shaped knit pieces are positioned with a boundary between them on the needle beds, and the final course loops of the two pieces are overlaid and bound off gradually to connect them.
* The moving needle bed is racked to transfer loops between the needle beds, allowing the overlaying and binding off of the loops to connect the two pieces.
* The method can be used to connect the end portions of the left and right front body panels of a sweater, as well as other tape- or rope-shaped parts in garments.
* The matrix texture of the connected knit fabric can be plain, rib, tubular, or any other.
* The invention can be realized using two or more pairs of needle beds, with either the front or rear needle bed being movable, or both being movable.
* The knitting process is controlled by a computer following a designed knitting pattern.
* The method eliminates the need for separate sewing or linking processes, improving productivity and reducing manufacturing costs.
* The connected knit fabric has a smooth appearance and improved comfort compared to manually sewn or linked connections.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a flexible traction element with at least one stranded cable made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength, such as steel, aramid, glass, ceramic, or carbon fibers.
• The core strand of each stranded cable is sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer, such as polyethylene, polypropylene, polyurethane, or polystyrene, to increase flexibility and adhesion.
• The production line for embedding the stranded cables in the plastics material jacket includes an extruder with a thread guide and a matrix that can be adjusted relative to each other to precisely control the position of the stranded cables.
• The method involves degreasing and/or pretreatment of the stranded cables to improve adhesion, preheating the cables to the melting temperature of the plastics material, and sheathing the cables in the extruder.
• The traction elements have a wide range of use, particularly for lifting and pulling loads, and can also be used as electric conductors.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, which includes a bobbin housing with a shoulder and a spring rod that cooperates with the shoulder to prevent the bobbin housing from co-rotating with the rotary hook.
• The spring rod is arranged between two cams, with the rear side face of the shoulder resting on the spring rod during operation, creating a gap between the front side face of the shoulder and the front cam.
• The needle thread loop can move unhindered through the gap during its expansion and pull-back, without being impeded by the holding means that prevent the bobbin housing from co-rotating.
• An optional capsule release device can briefly rotate the bobbin housing in the opposite direction, creating an even narrower gap between the rear side face of the shoulder and the spring rod, further reducing the impediment to the needle thread loop movement.
• The design of the rotary hook arrangement allows for a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, even without the use of the capsule release device.
• The slightly increased needle thread tension required without the capsule release device is still lower than with conventional rotary hooks.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides methods for producing silicon-containing nanowire/fiber composites and thin films using four-component and five-component liquid silane inks by electrospinning.
• The four-component ink consists of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent, while the five-component ink also includes a solid phase.
• Cyclohexasilane (Si6H12) and cyclopentasilane (Si5H10) are preferred liquid silanes, and polyhydropolysilanes are used as accelerants.
• The electrospun fibers are transformed into amorphous or crystalline silicon-containing materials through thermal or laser processing.
• The silicon-based materials can be coated with a conductive carbon layer and used as components in composite materials, such as electrodes for lithium-ion batteries.
• The methods allow for continuous, scalable production of silicon-based nanofibers and materials.
• The five-component inks can incorporate various solid phases, such as metal particles, carbon materials, and photoactive components, to tailor the properties of the final products.
• The silicon-based nanofibers and materials produced by the methods exhibit improved mechanical stability and electrochemical performance compared to bulk silicon.
• The invention provides a versatile platform for the synthesis of silicon-based nanostructures and composites for a wide range of applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders.
* Each spool holder has a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension-responsive braking element coupled to the brake rotor.
* A tensioning lever with a roller is coupled to the braking element and biased by the departing thread.
* A fluid pressure-sensitive biasing arrangement is connected to the tensioning lever to influence the thread tension.
* The fluid pressure can be controlled centrally for all the biasing arrangements to adjust the thread tension for the entire creel.
* The biasing arrangement can also operate on a brake shoe that can be applied to a further braking surface for rapid braking.
* The brake rotor can be a brake drum with a braking band or a braking disc with a magnetic braking system.
* The tensioning lever is oriented at an angle of 60-80 degrees to the horizontal, and the biasing arrangement is oriented at an angle of 30-40 degrees to the horizontal.
* The system allows for individual control of thread tension for each spool holder and global adjustment of thread tension for the entire creel.
* The rapid braking feature is useful when the warping machine served by the creel is shut off.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a sewing machine detector that can detect the position of the sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
• The conventional detector uses optical fibers and reflective discs, which can be affected by vibration and wear, leading to issues with signal detection.
• The invention uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs instead of reflective discs, which are more durable and less expensive to manufacture.
• The optical fibers are supported linearly, reducing stress and allowing for more compact design.
• The light shielding discs have different colored indicators to easily identify the needle up, needle down, and thread trimmer positions.
• The power indication is provided through a separate optical fiber, avoiding interference with the control circuitry.
• The invention can detect various signals, including needle position, speed, and thread trimmer timing, simultaneously.
• The linear support of the optical fibers and the stationary reflecting portions enable accurate and stable signal detection.
• The design allows for easy adjustment and maintenance of the optical axes during assembly.
• The invention provides a more durable, compact, and cost-effective sewing machine detector compared to the conventional design.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention describes a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
* The key steps in the process are: (1) completion of the coagulation until a final coagulation index of not higher than 1 is obtained, and (2) washing the yarn with water having a non-alkaline pH (between 4.0 and 5.5) to reduce the levels of certain elements (total sulfur, sulfur bound as sulfides, elemental sulfur, iron, zinc, and lead).
* The washing step is critical to achieving a high degree of whiteness (not lower than 45) in the final yarn, without the need for additional bleaching treatments.
* The process can be carried out at high spinning speeds (not lower than 90 m/min) and the washing step is preferably done at 20-30°C for 25-40 seconds.
* The wash water can be obtained by treating available industrial water with weakly acidic ion exchange resins to adjust the pH and reduce the levels of calcium and magnesium ions.
* Compared to the traditional process, the invention offers a simplified, more rapid, and more economical way to produce viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
</summary>

<summary>
• This is a continuation-in-part of a previous patent application.
• One of the problems with bleaching pulp with oxygen is the difficulty in washing the pulp after the oxygen stage due to the oxygen entrained in the pulp mat.
• The inventors devised a small deaeration tank with no moving parts to deaerate the pulp before washing.
• The deaeration tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl-inducing inlet pipe for the filtrate from the washer.
• The locations and sizes of these elements are designed to provide optimum deaeration.
• The deaeration tank is the same diameter as the oxygen reactor and can be placed on top of it.
• The tank can be closed to allow for the recovery of steam or oxygen.
• The height of the pulp in the tank is controlled by a sensor that adjusts the outlet valve.
• The tank dimensions and specifications are provided for a 50-ton-per-day installation.
</summary>

<summary>
* This invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
* The BTR composite structure consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be arranged in various configurations to achieve desired properties and shapes.
* The design of the BTR composite is based on a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process that employs topology optimization to optimize the material distribution for specific functions.
* The BTR composite can be fabricated using various materials, such as carbon fibers, nylon, Kevlar, and metal wires, and can be embedded in a matrix material to enhance its structural performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a load-limiting device that can be integrated into a braced frame structure to dissipate energy during a dynamic event, such as an earthquake.
• The load-limiting device is designed to undergo plastic deformation, forming plastic hinges that can absorb and dissipate energy, preventing extensive damage to the structure.
• The load-limiting device can be easily removed and replaced after a dynamic event, allowing the structure to be repaired and reused.
• The invention includes various design features, such as indicator means to detect plastic deformation, and the ability to accommodate different bracing configurations and load requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed for use as a flophouse facility, with a box-like structure and a flat external appearance.
• The cabinet has an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance between them that can be used to accommodate various devices and storage spaces without protruding into the living area.
• The cabinet is designed for efficient use of space, with features like an inclined backrest, storage boxes, and a curtain to block the entrance.
• The cabinet can be stacked or installed side-by-side, and the clearance between the casings allows for ventilation and sound-proofing.
• The cabinet can be easily assembled and wired, with the inner casing fitting into the lower outer casing and the upper outer casing then being attached.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the erection of a safety barrier or fence at construction sites, such as office buildings or high-rise apartments.
* The guard rail support comprises a flat base plate, an upright column, guard rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring, allowing for easy installation and removal of the safety barrier.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for stimulating crude oil reservoirs using a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic (EH) and electromagnetic (EM) methods to enhance oil production.
* The EH and EM pulses generate acoustic and coupled electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations that can cause oil flow to be enhanced and increase the estimated ultimate recovery from reservoirs.
* The invention uses a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well to extend the effective range of the stimulation.
* The invention can use multiple EH and EM sources in multiple wellbores to stimulate production of oil in a given direction or specific volume of the reservoir.
* The discharge characteristics of the pulse sources can be customized to produce specific frequencies that will achieve optimal stimulation by activating specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir.
* The invention includes the use of EM pulse sources that do not generate a direct acoustic shock pulse like the plasma shock effect caused by the spark gap in the EH device.
* The EH pulse source can be directed using a range of directional focusing and shaping devices to cause the acoustic pulse to travel only in specific directions.
* The pulse source can be placed in an injector well that is being used for water injection, surfactant injection, diluent injection, or CO2 injection.
* The fluids produced from the wellbore can be separated into its components, including associated gas, condensate, liquid hydrocarbons, helium and other noble gases, carbon dioxide, sulphur dioxide, pyrite, paraffins, and heavy metals.
</summary>

<summary>
• The document describes a splice for a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.
• The splice includes two wave plates that can receive and seat the transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip, allowing them to be coupled together.
• The splice uses connective devices, such as bolts and nuts, to secure the two wave plates and prevent the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip from escaping.
• The splice allows for the length of the soil reinforcing element to be extended by connecting it to one or more grid-strips, creating a composite soil reinforcing element.
• Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element to the desired distance for the MSE application.
• The document emphasizes that the design of the splice and its components can be modified without departing from the spirit and scope of the disclosure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a plow blade with a fluid passageway that allows for the ejection of fluid, such as water, at specific points along the blade to reduce friction and power required to pull the plow through the ground.
* The plow blade is designed with a modular construction that allows for easy customization and replacement of worn components, and the fluid passageway can be configured in various ways to optimize the fluid ejection for different soil conditions and installation depths.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is an evolution of the existing MCL StuccoRite® Cavity Wall Cavity System, a masonry cladding system incorporating a 35 mm vented cavity.
* The new system comprises proprietary plaster, reinforced with pre-papered hot dipped galvanised zinc steel wire MCL® StuccoRite® Mesh Sheet and other reinforcement, to achieve a nominal thickness of 21 mm.
* The plaster is applied in three coats: a base coat, a levelling coat, and a top coat, with the base coat encapsulating the pre-papered MCL® StuccoRite® Mesh Sheet reinforcement and additional reinforcement at corners and around joinery.
* Movement is accommodated by providing physical breaks in the plaster, achieved with a uPVC moulding for the vertical movement control joint (VMCJ) and a uPVC window head moulding and Z flashing for the horizontal movement control joint (HMCL).
* The system is intended to be fixed to timber walls with studs at 600 mm centres, heights up to 4.8 m and dwangs spaced at up to 900 mm centres.
* The location of Movement Control Joints (VMCJs) and Horizontal Movement Control Joints (HMCJs) shall be shown on the consented building elevations in compliance with the Rules.
* The MCL® Stucco Rite® System allows for the construction of decks, simply supported or cantilevered, following the requirements of NZS 3604.
* The system is able to resist wind face loading up to and including those associated with VH wind speed zones.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a safe with a valuables receiving chamber and a rectangular opening with a separate steel door.
* The door is inserted at an angle into a deeper groove on one side and then pivoted into a shallower groove on the other side, with a lock assembly on the reverse side of the door.
* The safe can be constructed using a liner and concrete, or can be an all-metal construction, and the invention is applicable to both floor and wall safes.
* The invention provides a simple, yet effective door and safe construction that is low-cost and readily assembled.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for accurately measuring fluid pressures in geological formations by cementing a conduit with a filter at the bottom end in a borehole, and then using a staged fluid injection process to clear the filter of cement grout and establish a fluid connection between the formation and the pressure sensor.
* The invention also discloses an alternative embodiment where the pressure sensor is located in a larger diameter tubing section near the surface, and a non-return valve is used to prevent fluid from being pushed out of the conduit during the grouting operation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and a method of mounting an elastic member therein, which is useful for applications in new transit systems, monorails, road bridges, and footbridges.
• The jointing structure comprises steps with an expansion gap between, elastic members mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap to prevent tire fall-in and stuck-in situations.
• The elastic members are designed to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner to absorb the expansion and contraction of the bridge girders, and the components are fitted in a detachable fashion for easy maintenance.
• The invention can prevent the occurrence of tire fall-in and stuck-in situations by decentralizing the expansion gap into smaller gaps and providing oblique expansion gaps.
• The method of mounting the elastic members involves joining them across the expansion gap, fixing one side, deforming the elastic members toward the bridge girder axis, and then fixing the other side to ensure the elastic members are in a deformation-free state when the bridge girder length is at its median.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a floor track system for transporting wheeled hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber, such as a meat chilling chamber.
• Conventional air chilling methods cause meat dehydration, while overhead rail systems can contaminate the recirculated brine solution.
• The invention aims to provide a floor track system that prevents the wheels of the hand trucks from contaminating the brine solution.
• One embodiment features a wheel channel with a cover plate that segregates the wheels from the brine solution.
• Another embodiment uses inflatable elastomer seals around the wheel struts to prevent brine solution from entering the track.
• The enclosed track system prevents corrosion of the hand truck wheels and maintains the sanitary condition of the brine solution.
• The track system can be inclined to drain any contaminated liquid into a waste sewer.
• The invention overcomes the disadvantages of both air chilling and overhead rail systems.
• The enclosed track system allows for the efficient recovery and reuse of the brine solution.
• The invention can be adapted for use with various types of wheeled transport vehicles.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a lock device that prevents a work machine, such as a backhoe, from being tilted by its own weight.
* The lock device comprises an engaging member (lock plate) and an engaged member (lock pin) that can be manually engaged and disengaged to lock and unlock the boom.
* The engaging member is designed with a slot and guide member to allow it to slide and rotate to the lock and unlock positions, and the guide member maintains the engaging member in the correct position even when the boom is at different angles.
* The lock device is designed to be easily assembled and operated, with features like a slip-prevention mechanism and integrated guide members to reduce the number of parts and assembly steps.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with a flexible platform and a central, vacuum portion that can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom to regulate suction efficiency.
• The device has adjustment mechanisms on the top of the suction head that can be used to quickly and easily adjust the spacing between the suction portion and the pool bottom, allowing for real-time regulation of the suction without adjusting the remote suction source.
• The adjustment mechanisms can be added to existing pool cleaning devices with minor modifications, allowing for easy retrofitting.
• The adjustment mechanisms are simple, easy to use, and inexpensive to manufacture.
• The device overcomes the drawbacks of prior art pool cleaning devices that lack an easy way to regulate suction during the cleaning operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving the wear bushing from around the interior of the well head and casing during oil and gas well drilling operations.
* Wear bushings are used to protect against excessive wear on the seal areas of the casing heads and other well head elements.
* The invention provides a sub-unit with a mandrel section that can be inserted between two sections of drill pipe, and a retriever section that can slide vertically along the mandrel section.
* The retriever section has protruding members that can engage with slots in the wear bushing, allowing it to be rotated and retrieved.
* The vertical play of the retriever section along the mandrel prevents damage to the wear bushing or the retriever section due to the weight of the drill string.
* The invention can be easily installed and removed from the drill string without having to retrieve the drill bit.
* An alternative embodiment of the retriever section has a threaded lower end to threadably engage with a threaded wear bushing.
* The invention solves the problem of the retriever section being rigidly connected to the drill pipe, which can lead to the wear bushing being damaged.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive solution to the problem of retrieving the wear bushing.
* The invention can be used with various embodiments and modifications within the scope of the inventive concept.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a downhole vibratory tool that allows passage of other tools through a central passage.
* Vibratory tools are used to dislodge stuck objects (fish) in a wellbore, especially in deviated wells.
* Previous designs had limitations, such as not allowing wireline access through the tool and having a dump valve in the center, preventing clear passage.
* The invention addresses these issues by having an annular dump valve that does not slam against a seat, allowing a central passage for wireline access.
* The tool can be activated by dropping a simple plug into the passage, without the need for a complex dart assembly.
* The tool uses a modular piston design to increase the power delivery of the vibrations.
* The tool can be operated to deliver high-amplitude, low-frequency oscillating forces without impacts, or with impacts on the up or down stroke.
* The tool can be used for stimulation or fishing operations, providing large-amplitude vibrations in the tubing string.
* The tool can have a rotational lock between the mandrel and the housing for torque transmission.
* The design features of the tool lead to a more economical and reliable design compared to previous vibratory tool designs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a precast concrete retaining wall system with a precast concrete face panel, an integral counterfort, and a precast concrete base.
* The face panel and counterfort are precast as a single modular unit, and the base is a separate precast modular unit that is connected to the face panel/counterfort unit on-site.
* The connection between the face panel/counterfort unit and the base is made by inserting the exposed rebar ends from the counterfort into openings in the base and securing them with grout.
* The precast modular design allows for taller walls and shorter bases, reduces installation and transportation costs, and eliminates the need for temporary shoring during installation.
* The invention also includes optional features such as drainage openings, impact barriers, and pile foundations for poor soil conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a down hole heating system for improving oil or gas production in wells where flow is impeded by high viscosity or paraffin blockage.
* The heating system is designed to focus heat on the production zone and prevent heat loss through insulation and use of materials with low thermal conductivity.
* The electrical connections of the heating unit are shielded from downhole fluids and pressures to prevent electrical shorts and corrosion, which is a common failure mode of conventional down hole heaters.
* The method of using the invention includes installing the heating unit and associated components in the well, as well as the option of using the heating unit with a wireline instead of production tubing.
* The invention addresses two key shortcomings of conventional down hole heaters: improper heat focusing and lack of protection for electrical components.
* Field applications of the invention have yielded significantly better results in improving well flow compared to existing down hole heating systems.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore.
• The mechanism includes an outer tubular body and an inner body structure that can move relative to each other, with a catch mechanism that can lock and unlock the inner and outer body structures.
• The catch mechanism has a locking position and an unlocking position, and can be controlled by the relative positions of the inner and outer body structures.
• The mechanism can be used for a variety of down hole service operations, including installation and removal of down hole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools within the well bore.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present application claims priority to PCT and Mexico patent applications related to modular composed stave floors.
• Conventional composed stave floors have drawbacks such as thin sight substrate thickness, deformation, and detachment.
• The example embodiment provides a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a sight substrate thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate thickness of at least 12 mm.
• The method uses multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal and vertical reinforcement, to assemble the substrates.
• The example embodiment aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate and provide a longer useful life for the floors.
• The example embodiment also provides pre-glazed floors, eliminating the need for on-site glazing.
• All numerical parameters are to be understood as approximate values.
• The example embodiment includes a conventional composed stave floor example that exhibited detachment and deformation.
• The example embodiment includes a composed stave floor of the invention that did not present deformation or detachment and allowed for corrective maintenance.
• The example embodiments may be varied in many ways without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to ladder attachments that position the ladder away from the work surface, prevent the ladder from defacing the work surface, and prevent the ladder from slipping or sliding.
• The ladder attachments include a brace assembly with an extension arm, a flange, a U-bolt, and a resilient pad assembly that pivotally connects to the extension arm.
• The brace assembly increases the contact area of the ladder with the work surface, improving lateral stability and allowing the ladder to straddle corners.
• The resilient pad assembly provides a non-slip gripping portion that does not damage the work surface.
• The brace assembly can be constructed with heavier gauge material or additional bolts to resist inward or outward movement of the arms, especially for less substantial ladders.
• The invention aims to provide a ladder attachment that improves the lateral stability of the ladder and prevents damage to the work surface.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fastener assembly with a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adheres to the fasteners.
* The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, or an epoxy, and is preheated to a high temperature (450°F to 600°F) before molding to improve adhesion.
* The collation system includes a collar portion that captures the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between adjacent collars, with various configurations to improve rigidity, penetration, and reduce debris.
* The connecting portion can be designed with preferentially weakened regions to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location, reducing debris.
* The collation can include upper and lower plastic moldings adhered to the fasteners, with the lower molding being narrower than the upper molding to reduce debris.
* The fasteners can include features like rings, serrations, or deformations on the shank to further improve penetration and reduce debris.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants such as silicones in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* The nozzle comprises a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a specific design.
* The nozzle can be connected to sealant cartridges or injection machines, providing versatility in its use.
* The bell-shaped section is designed to encapsulate rivets or nuts, allowing for precise sealant application.
* The injection button has channels and orifices that enable directing the sealant flow towards the chamfers of rivet heads or the walls of screw orifices.
* The nozzle can be used for manual sealant application from cartridges or automated sealant injection machines.
* The nozzle design simplifies the sealing work, reduces application time, and increases the quality of the sealant application.
* The nozzle can be modified by cutting the bell-shaped section to obtain a traditional truncated-cone shaped nozzle for applying sealant cords or filler sealants.
* The nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene, and the button can be non-permanently coupled to the bell-shaped section.
* The nozzle provides a considerable improvement over the currently available nozzles in the market for sealant application.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a position sensor that can be used to monitor the position or movement of an object, such as in an internal combustion engine.
• The sensor includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator that modifies the sensing signal to remove unwanted power and noise, and provides the conditioned signal to a remote monitor via two wires.
• The error correction generator uses a comparator, controller, and signal processor to determine and eliminate static and error signals that do not provide information about the object's position, reducing the energy required by the sensor.
• The sensor can automatically calibrate itself upon power-up to draw minimum current, and can be recalibrated externally by removing and reapplying power.
• The sensor uses a window reference circuit to constantly compare the desired and actual conditioned sensor signals, and adjusts the output if it is above or below preset reference levels.
• The sensor's digital-to-analog converter and counter combination have enough resolution to ensure that the error correction signal is not a significant portion of the position signal.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention discloses a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines that eliminates the need for springs and provides variable valve displacement.
• The system uses a rotating cam and a translating mechanism to generate a reciprocating linear motion, which is then converted into a variable reciprocating motion to control the valve position.
• The variable displacement is achieved by a rotatable link with a slot that interacts with pins on the valve, allowing the valve opening to be adjusted from fully open to fully closed.
• The system allows for individual control of each valve, enabling the engine to operate with a variable number of active cylinders and optimized valve openings for different driving conditions.
• The elimination of springs and reduced mass inertia of the valve system enables higher engine speeds and improved efficiency compared to traditional cam-and-spring systems.
• The invention can be applied to engines with different numbers of valves per cylinder, including four-valve and six-valve configurations.
• The system is designed to be simple, robust, and easily manufactured, assembled, and installed compared to traditional cam-and-spring systems.
• The invention provides a computer-controlled, highly sensitive, and precise valve actuation system that can optimize engine performance and fuel efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, with a light member that includes a housing with a top side and a bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side.
* The lighting control region includes multiple control channels (e.g., for white and blue light) that can be controlled independently, and light-emitting modules that can be releasably coupled to the control channels.
* The light-emitting modules have electrical connectors that couple to the control channels, and can be positioned along the lighting control region as desired.
* The light member can include features like switches, timers, remote control, and optical elements to customize the lighting.
* The light member can also be used for lighting under cabinets, with a bracket for mounting the light member and the ability to connect multiple light members in series.
* The light-emitting modules or lighting control regions can be designed specifically for use with aquariums or under cabinets.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine that operates at high temperatures, such as a gas turbine.
* Current flow deflection apparatuses, like stator or rotor blades, use cast cooling channels and separating walls, which have several disadvantages.
* The invention proposes using separate inserts as separating walls instead of cast ones, which offers several advantages:
* No large amount of material in the transitional region from the hot-gas wall to the insert, reducing thermal stresses.
* Reduced blade weight and centrifugal-force stresses, especially for rotating blades.
* Simpler cast core and easier adjustment of the cooling system by replacing the inserts.
* The inserts can be straight or bent into a U-shape to provide deflection devices.
* The inserts can be secured by integral material joints, such as soldering or welding, especially at the end close to the rotation axis for high-speed rotor blades.
* The invention can be applied to blades in gas turbines, simplifying the complex blade geometry.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be switched between manual and automatic control.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or a stepper motor that automatically sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.
* The system allows for a smooth transition between automatic and manual control of the throttle valve, preventing the vehicle from lurching forward or stalling, and providing the driver with full control of the vehicle during manual operation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a waste fuel burner that generates heat from particulate-laden gas or directly from waste fuels such as wood waste.
• The burner forms a conical pile of waste fuel, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile to dry and gasify the fuel.
• The volatile gases are partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber, with the total combustion air kept below stoichiometric proportions to prevent ash melting.
• Additional swirl air is introduced to maintain a steady temperature and force particulate out of the gas stream.
• The volatile gases pass through an air-cooled flame holder, which forces the gases and entrained particulate matter out to the walls, causing the particulate to separate and fall back into the primary chamber.
• The volatile gases then enter a secondary combustion chamber, where additional combustion air is introduced for complete combustion.
• The invention can be used with any source of dirty, particulate-laden combustible gas to effectively burn the gas and remove the particulate.
• The burner has a fast response time to changes in load, can burn wet wood, and produces little slag or clinkers.
• The design of the primary and secondary chambers, air introduction, and flame holder allows for efficient combustion and particulate separation.
• The control system adjusts the air and fuel feed rates to maintain the desired combustion conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes an evaporative refrigeration system that separates the evaporating water from the cooling air stream using a heat exchanger, allowing for sensible cooling without adding moisture to the useful air.
* The system uses return air from the enclosure as the working air on the wet side of the heat exchanger, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than fresh air, and can incorporate a hybrid design with a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool and dehumidify a portion of the air.
</summary>

<summary>
* The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads arranged in series, with each pump head containing an impeller driven by a drive structure.
* The pump heads are designed to combine the fluid flow from multiple conduits into a single flow before entering the next pump head.
* The drive structure, which may include one or more drive shafts, is configured to commonly drive the impellers in the pump heads.
* The pump heads can be connected in a modular fashion, allowing for easy repair and the inclusion of additional pump heads to increase the operating pressure.
* The fluid pump can be mounted on various support structures, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, to facilitate operation near a fluid reservoir.
* The novel features of the fluid pump include the design of the pump heads and the drive structure to enable high-volume, high-pressure fluid pumping.
* The fluid pump cannot be constructed by simply stacking known pumps together, as the initial, final, and intermediate pump heads have unique design features to enable the series flow of fluid and common driving of the impellers.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an engine compression release brake system that uses less than all engine cylinders.
• Traditional engine compression release brake systems typically include a brake for each engine cylinder, which can result in excess components.
• The invention provides an engine with an engine compression release brake for a portion, less than all, of the engine cylinders.
• The method of engine braking using less than all engine cylinders involves attaching an engine compression release brake to a portion of the engine cylinders and operating that portion in a braking mode.
• The engine compression release brakes are operably coupled to cam-actuated exhaust valves.
• The engine includes a high-pressure pump, a high-pressure manifold, and a low-pressure reservoir to supply fluid to the engine compression release brakes.
• The engine compression release brake includes a hydraulically actuated piston that contacts the exhaust valve actuator to open the exhaust valve during the compression stroke.
• The engine compression release brake can be positioned above or below the rocker arm, and the number of brakes can be varied to provide the desired braking horsepower.
• The modular design of the engine compression release brake system allows customers to choose and pay for only the amount of braking horsepower they require.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes must withstand extreme loads, such as those caused by blade-off events.
• The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin that retains the male and female links.
• The female link receives the male link, allowing translation and dampening the translation through a radial interface.
• The pin can shear at a predetermined load, allowing the male and female links to translate and absorb the extreme loads.
• The radial interface between the male and female links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy during translation.
• The snap ring can limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link.
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to be capable of surviving extreme loads.
• The pin can be replaced during maintenance following a shock that breaks it.
• The invention provides a way to protect the gearbox and attached systems from extreme loads while preventing the gearbox from detaching from the engine.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to archery equipment, particularly apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts.
* The invention provides a point cap system, a balance pin, and a nock cap adaptor to address the shortcomings of the prior art, such as stress on the arrow shaft and dirt entering the shaft.
* The invention utilizes the strength of the reinforcing fibers in the arrow shaft, allows for adjustable weight balance, and provides a means to replace damaged parts without rendering the entire arrow shaft useless.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training.
• The simulator utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic that is electrically ignited to produce sound and flash, simulating small arms fire.
• The simulator is designed to be inserted into a weapon, such as an M16 rifle, and interfaces with the weapon's trigger and bolt to provide realistic training without the use of live ammunition.
• The simulator includes an electrical control circuit that provides for automatic and semi-automatic fire, and a MILES interface to integrate with the weapon's training system.
• The simulator is designed to be cost-effective, reliable, and low-maintenance, providing a realistic simulation of small arms fire without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber.
• The simulator is packaged to resemble the magazine clip of the M16 rifle, further enhancing the realism of the training experience.
</summary>

<summary>
• The air intake device of an internal combustion engine utilizes the dynamic effects of the air flow to improve the volumetric efficiency of the engine.
• The device comprises a tank, a first pipe, and a second pipe, where the second pipe has a smaller cross-sectional area than the first pipe and opens to the intake passage at a location nearer the air cleaner.
• The device includes a control valve in the first pipe, which is actuated by an engine operating condition to open or close the valve, improving engine performance and reducing intake noise.
• The valve operation is controlled based on the engine speed and load, with the valve being opened only when the load is above a certain level and the speed is above a certain threshold.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a two-part mounting bracket that allows simple mounting of speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure. The stationary bracket is attached to the mounting surface, and the adjustable bracket is attached to the equipment, allowing the equipment to be easily aimed in a particular direction.
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket that can be connected together without tools or hardware, and the adjustable bracket can be rotated and secured in the desired position using screws. The stationary bracket can be mounted on a wall or pole using a pole mounting bracket and a chain or strap.
</summary>

<summary>
* The disclosure relates to a burner that can be used with various modular heat-utilizing appliances, such as cooking grills, cooktops, food smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.
* The burner has a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, and air flows through the fuel holder and around it to support primary, secondary, and tertiary combustion, improving efficiency and reducing emissions.
* The burner has features like a pivotally coupled ash pan, a perforate food grate, a cover, and manual couplings to allow the modular heat-utilizing appliances to be easily attached and detached.
* The burner can be used with a pyrolyzer that can capture and utilize the vaporized products of pyrolysis to supplement or replace the solid fuel in the burner.
* The burner can be provided with a fuel feed feature to enable continuous, long-term operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The source document discusses the design and cooling system of a rotary internal combustion engine, particularly the arrangement of spark plug bosses in the engine housing.
* The in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in the engine's water jacket passageway disrupts the cooling flow, leading to the formation of vapor films and hindering heat extraction.
* The invention proposes a staggered arrangement of the spark plug bosses, which improves the distribution of coolant velocities around the boss surfaces and provides separate paths for vapor release during boiling heat transfer.
* The staggered boss arrangement increases the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the in-line arrangement.
* The spark plug terminals are positioned to approach an in-line arrangement on the trochoid surface, while the bosses are arranged in a staggered configuration within the cooling passage.
* The boss centerlines are skewed at specific angles with respect to the longitudinal and transverse planes of the cooling passage to optimize the flow regime.
* The longitudinal spacing between the bosses is limited to reduce side wall effects on the flow.
* The staggered boss configuration controls the high-velocity flow through the passage, preventing uncontrolled swirling eddies and maintaining a high heat transfer coefficient at the sensitive spark plug boss surfaces.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a method of using control valve position as feedback to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• The method calculates the total mass flow through N parallel turbine inlet control valves as a function of control valve position and compensates for the flow change when one of the valves is closed for testing.
• The flow characteristics for the system with N valves and N-1 valves are determined during the turbine design process, and the difference in flow characteristics is used to adjust the flow through the remaining N-1 valves to maintain constant total flow.
• The method uses a test compensation circuit that includes a lookup table and a compensation reference signal to adjust the flow through the remaining valves and minimize pressure and power changes during the valve testing.
• The method was tested on a simulated turbine system and was found to reduce the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95% compared to the system without the flow compensation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that can combine fluids from two separate sources (soap solution and water) into one mixture.
• The mixing valve has a valve body with two inlet passages and one outlet passage, and a valve means that can be adjusted to control the proportion of the two fluids in the mixture.
• The valve means includes a spool valve with two offset bores that can be aligned with the inlet and outlet passages to control the flow of the two fluids.
• The valve system includes a flow restricting device to maintain constant fluid pressures at the two inlet passages, even when multiple valve systems are connected to the same fluid sources.
• The maximum flow rate of each fluid occurs only when its respective bore is aligned with the corresponding inlet and outlet passages, which also helps maintain constant fluid pressures.
• The valve system allows continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of soap solution and water in the output mixture, ranging from 0% water/100% soap solution to 100% water/0% soap solution.
• The valve system is designed to be used in a stand-alone cleaning apparatus for aircraft, allowing multiple users to control the strength of the cleaning solution independently.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and an arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
* The method involves compressing the gas to a substantially higher pressure (excess pressure) than the desired exit pressure, cooling the compressed gas by heat exchange, and obtaining the further cooling to the desired exit temperature by expanding the gas from the excess pressure to the desired exit pressure.
* The arrangement includes a compressor, a heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, and an electronic control that operates the compressor to compress the gas to an excess pressure and an expanding unit to expand the compressed gas to the desired exit pressure.
* The invention provides a more efficient and cost-effective solution compared to conventional re-cooling technology, reducing investment and operational costs, as well as the risk of accidents.
</summary>

<summary>
* The source document describes a cooling fan mounting system that eliminates the need for traditional fasteners, such as screws, to secure the cooling fan to an enclosure.
* The cooling fan assembly includes a motor, a fan blade, and a motor carrier with mounting legs that have resilient leg portions.
* The panel or enclosure has recessed portions with openings that correspond to the mounting legs, allowing the turned-out portions of the resilient legs to be inserted into the enlarged opening regions.
* By applying a combined compressive and rotating force, the resilient legs are moved from the enlarged opening regions to the intermediate and then residual opening regions, securing the cooling fan assembly to the panel.
* The spring members in the cooling fan assembly help prevent vibration and movement of the assembly, keeping it firmly in place.
* The design allows the turned-out portions of the resilient legs to not extend beyond the plane of the enclosure exterior, enabling adjacent components to be placed directly against the enclosure.
* The cooling fan mounting system can be used in various applications, including automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation, where forced air movement is required for cooling.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides kinematic mounts that incorporate novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads.
* The damping mechanism is provided at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts, using either a spherical damper or a cylindrical slot damper with viscoelastic damping materials.
* The damped kinematic mounts can be arranged in a variety of configurations, including a classical arrangement pattern or a center-of-gravity mounting system with six nearly uncoupled suspension modes.
* The proposed mounting scheme offers significant design simplification and performance improvements over existing kinematic mount designs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a large-size oil shear type clutch unit, particularly for use in an aircraft catapult system, that overcomes the disadvantages of previously known constructions.
* The clutch unit comprises separate piston and cylinder means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates, which minimizes residual drag and provides improved cooling and torque control.
* The clutch discs are made up of segmented, removable components, allowing for convenient inspection and replacement without requiring complete disassembly of the unit.
* The clutch unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for both retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes an engine with combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders, where the exhaust gas from the combustion cylinders is used to drive the expansion cylinders, and water is injected into the system to create steam and further drive the expansion cylinders.
• The invention aims to maximize the thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction by using multiple stages of expansion cylinders, with each stage having a larger displacement than the previous one, to lower the temperature of the exhaust gas and eliminate the need for a radiator.
• The invention also includes features such as catalytic materials on the surfaces to reduce exhaust emissions, water recovery and reuse, and gearing between the combustion and expansion cylinders to optimize the output.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a steel plate with a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, where the metal alloy layer is removed in an area at the periphery of the plate.
• Removing the metal alloy layer in a specific area prevents the introduction of the precoat into the molten metal during welding, and ensures good corrosion resistance of the welded and heat-treated part.
• The width of the area where the metal alloy layer is removed is 20-40% greater than half the width of the weld to achieve these benefits.
• The removal of the metal alloy layer can be done by brushing or laser ablation, and the process can be monitored by optical or spectroscopic methods.
• The steel composition, welding, and heat treatment processes are optimized to obtain a martensitic, bainitic, or bainitic-martensitic microstructure with high strength and ductility, making the parts suitable for automotive structural and safety applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) remote control system for a mobile structure that recovers energy from severe weather patterns.
* The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data from various sources such as GPS, weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites.
* The mobile structure has a control and communications microprocessor system that communicates with the central service facility through wireless communication.
* The central service facility houses a server that aggregates weather data from various sources and communicates with the mobile structure.
* The mobile structure has various sensors and control circuits that provide input to the microprocessor system, which in turn controls the mechanical components of the mobile structure.
* The Graphical User Interface (GUI) on the client workstations at the central service facility allows human operators to monitor and control the mobile structure.
* The GUI displays information such as the mobile structure's position, heading, velocity, and points of sail, as well as weather data and path analysis.
* The SCADA algorithm optimizes the energy extraction by accounting for weather data and the mobile structure's performance models.
* The system can also be used for logistics-only purposes to guide vessels past weather patterns without considering energy extraction.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined together in the circumferential direction, reducing production costs.
* The flat material ring segments are welded together, preferably by laser welding, to form the ring element.
* The ring segments can be punched out from a sheet metal strip and joined together during the punching process.
* The joint contours of the ring segments form an undercut geometry to positively interlock the segments.
* The ring element can be further formed into various rolling body guide cage designs, such as for ball bearings and roller bearings.
* Material beads can be formed along the edges to be welded to improve the weld quality.
* Local material forming can be used to achieve axial securing of the ring segments.
* The ring segments can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip to ensure uniform material properties.
* The production method reduces material waste compared to the prior art.
</summary>

<summary>
* The methods and systems described in the text provide a way to obtain and use location information, such as latitude and longitude coordinates, associated with a customer's service location to improve customer service and response time.
* The text also describes a system that can provide driving directions to a service technician traveling between multiple customer service locations using the location information obtained through the methods and systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields.
* The system uses two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a digital control unit.
* The output signals of the two real sensors are combined to create a virtual sensor that represents the amplitude of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected.
* The virtual sensor signals are processed by independent control loops to generate control signals for the compensation coils.
* The control algorithm can use linear or nonlinear control methods and can be optimized for different applications.
* The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
* The system can simulate the measurement of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected.
* The system can equalize feedback effects when two compensation systems are used in close proximity.
* The system can use a single coil per axis instead of Helmholtz coil pairs for inhomogeneous interference fields.
* The system can adjust the control parameters when the structure of the interfering field changes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy, where at least one resonance site is furnished by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
* The bioorthogonal reaction can be used to introduce resonance sites into the sample, including the non-resonant background, to improve the specificity and reproducibility of CARS microscopy.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, such as clinicians or autosegmentation programs, for radiation therapy.
* The system compares two segmentation files by generating volume models and identifying common, missing, and extra volume elements.
* The system outputs a measure of conformance between the segmentations based on the missing and extra volume elements.
* The system can display the segmentations overlaid on a cross-sectional image of the patient, with the common, missing, and extra volume elements highlighted in different colors.
* The system allows users to customize the metric method used to assess the segmentations, including weighting the volume elements based on their distance from the reference segmentation.
* The system can be used for training clinicians, evaluating autosegmentation programs, and assessing whether a new treatment plan should be prepared based on changes in the patient's internal anatomy.
* The system can automatically match metric methods to specific structures based on the structure names in the segmentation files.
* The system provides a graphical representation of the metric method to assist in the development of custom metric methods.
* The system can display a histogram showing the cumulative missing and extra volume elements as a function of distance ranges.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus and method for accelerating the execution of floating-point operations, particularly the effective subtraction operation.
* The effective subtraction operation involves several steps, including aligning the operand fractions, subtracting the aligned quantities, and normalizing the result.
* The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by determining the difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments, and using this subset difference to begin the subtraction of the operand fractions.
* The subset difference is chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset difference, the correct final fraction result is one of the operand fractions, which are already available.
* The invention divides the effective subtraction operation into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference between the operand exponent arguments.
* The invention uses a detection and logic unit, a shift and selection logic unit, and a selection logic unit to implement the accelerated effective subtraction operation.
* The invention allows the calculation of the operand fraction difference to be initiated before the complete operand argument difference is determined, thereby accelerating the overall effective subtraction operation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention discloses a method for tracking a specimen acquired from a patient to reduce mislabeling errors.
• The method involves storing unique machine-readable codes (barcodes) for the patient's ID, the specimen order, the specimen-taker's ID, and the specimen container in a relational manner in a computer storage.
• The method verifies the relationship between the patient's ID and the specimen order before allowing the specimen to be collected and stored in the container.
• The method also checks the expiration date of the specimen container and generates an alert if the container is out-of-date.
• The method tracks the time between the signal to collect the specimen and the actual collection, and stores this information in the relational database.
• The method eliminates the need for manual labeling of specimen containers, reducing the risk of mislabeling errors.
• The invention can be applied to various types of biological specimens, not just blood samples.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device, such as for providing distance and other information to a golfer.
• The device uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide the user with data on the golf course and its parameters in a verbal, electronically spoken form.
• The device can be incorporated into an article of clothing or other portable device, such as a golf hat or visor, and can use various distance measuring technologies.
• The device can also accept verbal or other data input to predict golf course strategy, club selection, and other golf player needs based on the user's past performance.
• The device can use Bluetooth technology for data transfers, audio communication, and as a remote GPS.
• The device can also allow users to record geographic coordinates of a golf course, including its hazards and fairway boundaries, using a portable computing device equipped with a GPS.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
* The invention eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool.
* The invention creates customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions that might be included on a chip, where such customized rules are based on modifying a standard logic rule by "pushing" more liberal memory-based parameters onto a stricter logic-based parameter.
* The invention categorizes the results in different categories in accordance with where they occur, such as in Logic, Bordered Single Port (BDSP) SRAM, Borderless Single Port (BLSP) SRAM, Dual Port (DP) SRAM and ROM groups.
* The invention accurately detects and classifies mistakes or any modifications made to standardized foundry bit cell designs as may be made by memory compiler vendors or layout engineers at the IC designer.
* The invention applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data, and this is achieved by modifying a standard set of Logic Rules as needed to reflect needs of particular regions in the chip.
* The invention should find significant usage in the semiconductor industry and similar industries where different design rules must be applied to different types of regions on a substrate.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention was made with government support and is a continuation-in-part of a previous patent application.
• The invention relates to the use of waveguide holograms for illuminating objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.
• Waveguide holograms offer advantages over conventional illumination systems, including compact size, high diffraction efficiency, and reduced stray light.
• Challenges with waveguide holograms include alignment sensitivity, illumination depletion, and the generation of two diffracted beams.
• Compensation techniques, such as non-uniform hologram recording and the use of photographic negatives, can be employed to address these challenges.
• The invention describes two basic architectures for recording the waveguide hologram grating and provides examples of illuminating a spatial light modulator and reconstructing a 3D holographic image.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for non-destructively testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, particularly squirrel cage rotors for induction motors, to measure their resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew.
* The test apparatus includes a test head with exciting windings to magnetize the rotor, voltage and current sensing means to generate signals representative of the rotor's characteristics, and processing means to determine the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor from the sensor signals.
* The test apparatus can automatically perform the rotor test, acquire the data, and process the results to identify defective rotors based on predetermined threshold values for the measured parameters.
* The test apparatus also provides statistical analysis capabilities to track the quality of the rotors over multiple test runs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The text describes a method for securing a computing device, such as a mobile device, by granting access to managed libraries while denying access to native resources for managed applications.
* The method involves an arbitration layer that includes a manager and a runtime host, where the manager authorizes access to native resources based on digital certificates associated with the managed libraries and applications.
* The text also describes a process for verifying and signing managed applications, including inspecting the managed metadata to ensure the code is type-safe, and storing the verified applications in a digitally signed container.
* The container can be transmitted to a mobile device, where the title player and manager are used to authenticate the container and manage the access of the managed application to native resources.
* The text emphasizes the need for alternative techniques to supplement typical security measures in closed mobile devices, allowing third-party applications to execute while protecting the device from malicious code.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved identification card that contains an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.
* The identification card is designed to protect the electronic components from damage due to bending stresses, and the manufacturing process involves a lamination process that is simpler and less costly than the mold-based processes used in the prior art.
* The identification card uses a core layer and bottom layer made of silica-filled polyolefin, with the antenna and integrated circuit chip sandwiched between them, and the entire structure is then laminated between two polymer layers to provide mechanical strength and protection.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory environment using a tree-shaped data structure.
* The tree-shaped data structure has internal nodes and leaf nodes, with all leaf nodes at the same level and internal nodes being full except for those on the edges.
* Additions are made to the first non-full node on the left edge, and deletions are made from the rightmost leaf node.
* The copying required for updates is logarithmic in the length of the queue, as only the path from the root to the update point needs to be copied.
* A separate header node can be used to store pointers to the beginning and end of the queue, improving the efficiency of additions and deletions.
* The header node can also include a bit to indicate the direction of the queue, allowing it to be inverted in constant time and space.
* The queue can be implemented as a double-ended queue (deque) using the inversion bit.
* The memory arrangement includes an actual memory, intermediate registers, and control logic to maintain the queue.
* Additions and deletions are performed by updating the intermediate registers and the tree-shaped data structure in the actual memory.
* The invention provides an efficient way to implement a FIFO queue in a functional memory environment.
